workflow.name: Generate Weather-Based Date Itineraries with Google Places, OpenRouter AI, and Slack
workflow.description:
üß© What this template does

This workflow builds a 120-minute local date course around your starting point by querying Google Places for nearby spots, selecting the top candidates, fetching real-time weather data, letting an AI generate a matching emoji, and drafting a friendly itinerary summary with an LLM in both English and Japanese.
It then posts the full bilingual plan with a walking route link and weather emoji to Slack.

üë• Who it‚Äôs for

Makers and teams who want a plug-and-play bilingual local itinerary generator with weather awareness ‚Äî no custom code required.

‚öôÔ∏è How it works

Trigger ‚Äì Manual (or schedule/webhook).

Discovery ‚Äì Google Places nearby search within a configurable radius.

Selection ‚Äì Rank by rating and pick the top 3.

Weather ‚Äì Fetch current weather (via OpenWeatherMap).

Emoji ‚Äì Use an AI model to match the weather with an emoji üå§Ô∏è.

Planning ‚Äì An LLM writes the itinerary in Markdown (JP + EN).

Route ‚Äì Compose a Google Maps walking route URL.

Share ‚Äì Post the bilingual itinerary, route link, and weather emoji to Slack.

üß∞ Requirements

n8n (Cloud or self-hosted)

Google Maps Platform (Places API)

OpenWeatherMap API key

Slack Bot (chat:write)

LLM provider (e.g., OpenRouter or DeepL for translation)

üöÄ Setup (quick)

Open Set ‚Üí Fields: Config and fill in coords/radius/time limit.

Connect Credentials for Google, OpenWeatherMap, Slack, and your LLM.

Test the workflow and confirm the bilingual plan + weather emoji appear in Slack.

üõ† Customize

Adjust ranking filters (type, min rating).

Modify translation settings (target language or tone).

Change output layout (side-by-side vs separated).

Tune emoji logic or travel mode.

Add error handling, retries, or logging for production use.

workflow.name: Generate Local Date Itineraries with Google Places, AI, and Slack Sharing

parameters.content:
## Node: Set Parameters
Configure the starting point and constraints.
- `startLat`, `startLng`, `radius`, `timeLimitMin`
- Optional: `placeType`, `language`, `minRating`.
**Tip:** Keep API keys in **Credentials**, not here.

## Node: Get Nearby Spots
Call **Google Places Nearby Search**.
- Endpoint: `/maps/api/place/nearbysearch/json`
- Use a **Google credential** (no inline `key=`).
- You can change `type` (default `cafe`) and `radius`.

## Node: Select Top 3 Spots
Rank and filter places.
- Sort by rating (desc), optionally by reviews.
- Keep top 3; drop duplicates/unrated.
- Keep total time within `timeLimitMin` (walking).

## Node: Create Google Maps Link
Build a **walking route URL** for Google Maps.
- origin ‚Üí waypoints (top spots) ‚Üí destination
- Embed as: `üó∫Ô∏è <https://‚Ä¶|View the route on Google Maps>`

## Node: Merge Chat + Map
Combine the itinerary text with the route link.
- Ensures the Slack message contains both contents.

## Node: Slack Output
Post to Slack.
- Set the channel (e.g., `#general`).
- Enable `mrkdwn`, disable link/media unfurling.
- Message = itinerary text(s) + route link.

## Node: OpenRouter Chat Model
Language model used by **Thinking Date Plan**.
- Set your **OpenRouter credential**.
- Keep prompts lightweight; avoid secrets in text.

## Node: Thinking Date Plan
Generate a friendly itinerary in Markdown with an LLM.
- Include: order, stay time, one-line tip.
- Output should be Japanese; Markdown only.
- No Google Maps URL here (added later).

## Node: Run Workflow Manually
Test the workflow with a manual trigger first.
- Good for validation and screenshots.
- You can later replace it with **Schedule** or **Webhook**.

## Node: Format Message for Slack
Prepare a clean JSON structure for Slack.
- Keep `text` (EN) / `text_ja` (JA) and `mapsUrl`.
- Use concise, readable Markdown.

## Node: Translate Plan (EN ‚Üî JA)
Translate with **DeepL**.
- Target: `EN-US` (you can change locale).
- Credential required; keep **mrkdwn** rendering in mind.

## üß© What this template does

This workflow builds a 120-minute local date course around your starting point by querying Google Places for nearby spots, selecting the top candidates, fetching real-time weather data, letting an AI generate a matching emoji, and drafting a friendly itinerary summary with an LLM in both English and Japanese.
It then posts the full bilingual plan with a walking route link and weather emoji to Slack.

## üë• Who it‚Äôs for

Makers and teams who want a plug-and-play bilingual local itinerary generator with weather awareness ‚Äî no custom code required.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How it works

Trigger ‚Äì Manual (or schedule/webhook).

Discovery ‚Äì Google Places nearby search within a configurable radius.

Selection ‚Äì Rank by rating and pick the top 3.

Weather ‚Äì Fetch current weather (via OpenWeatherMap).

Emoji ‚Äì Use an AI model to match the weather with an emoji üå§Ô∏è.

Planning ‚Äì An LLM writes the itinerary in Markdown (JP + EN).

Route ‚Äì Compose a Google Maps walking route URL.

Share ‚Äì Post the bilingual itinerary, route link, and weather emoji to Slack.

## üß∞ Requirements

n8n (Cloud or self-hosted)

Google Maps Platform (Places API)

OpenWeatherMap API key

Slack Bot (chat:write)

LLM provider (e.g., OpenRouter or DeepL for translation)

## üöÄ Setup (quick)

Open Set ‚Üí Fields: Config and fill in coords/radius/time limit.

Connect Credentials for Google, OpenWeatherMap, Slack, and your LLM.

Test the workflow and confirm the bilingual plan + weather emoji appear in Slack.

## üõ† Customize

Adjust ranking filters (type, min rating).

Modify translation settings (target language or tone).

Change output layout (side-by-side vs separated).

Tune emoji logic or travel mode.

Add error handling, retries, or logging for production use.

parameters.text:
=Given the following weather description, output one emoji that best represents the weather condition.

Weather description: {{$json.weather[0].description}}

Examples:
- clear sky ‚Üí ‚òÄÔ∏è
- few clouds ‚Üí üå§Ô∏è
- overcast clouds ‚Üí ‚òÅÔ∏è
- light rain ‚Üí üå¶Ô∏è
- heavy rain ‚Üí üåßÔ∏è
- thunderstorm ‚Üí ‚õàÔ∏è
- snow ‚Üí ‚ùÑÔ∏è
- mist or fog ‚Üí üå´Ô∏è
- haze ‚Üí üåÅ
- wind ‚Üí üí®

Respond with only one emoji, no explanation or text.

parameters.content:
## Get Current Weather
üå¶Ô∏è Fetch current weather data from OpenWeatherMap.

- Input: Coordinates (lat, lon)
- Output: JSON (weather[0].main, weather[0].description, weather[0].icon)
- Used for: Emoji generation and Slack summary

üí°Tip: Use Metric format for ¬∞C output.

## AI Weather Emoji Generator

ü§ñ Convert weather text into a matching emoji.

- Input: weather[0].main or description
- Model: OpenRouter Chat (gpt-4o / gpt-4o-mini)
- Output: Emoji representing the current weather

Example:
"Clear" ‚Üí ‚òÄÔ∏è
"Rain" ‚Üí üåßÔ∏è
"Snow" ‚Üí ‚ùÑÔ∏è
"Thunderstorm" ‚Üí ‚õàÔ∏è

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
